wikipedia_page.main: Julian Tufnell Faber (6 April 1917 – 11 January 2002) was a leading figure in the insurance business.

response: Caroline Macmillan was born in 1923. She attended West Heath Girls' School, and was offered a place to study medicine at Oxford, but did not take it up. Instead, she served as an ambulance driver in World War II, during which time she met her future husband, insurance executive Julian Faber, who was an officer in the Welsh Guards.
* Mark James Julian Faber (1950–1991), a Sussex cricketer. Married Ann Griffith, and has issue.
* Lady Caroline Macmillan (1923–2016). Married Julian Faber; five children. Their last surviving child following the death of Lady Catherine Macmillan in 1991.

He first married Anne Christine Adriane Faber (1944–28 November 2002) in 1970, and divorced 1981. Faber was the eldest child and only daughter of Julian Faber and his wife Lady Caroline Faber (née Macmillan), a daughter of Harold Macmillan. They had one son and one daughter.

response: Mark James Julian Faber (15 August 1950 – 10 December 1991) was an English cricketer who played for Oxford University and Sussex from 1970 to 1976.
